post.content:
Thank you for your interest in applying for the 2006 Korean Canadian Science Scholarship Foundation (KCSSF) awards.  Enclosed is the 2006 Award Information Package.
Number of Awards: 6          
Amount of each award:
$3,000 @ 1 (SK Scholarship in Life Science)
$1,000 @ 1 (Korean Canadian Medical Association [KCMA])
$1,000 @ 4 (Korean Canadian Science Scholarship Foundation)

Requirements:
Must be a Canadian citizen of a landed immigrant with Korean heritage.
Must be enrolled as a full-time student majoring science or engineering in 2005/2006 academic year and must have completed at least two full academic years in a post secondary education institution (e.g., university, college) in Canada and able to submit proof of registration prior to receipt of scholarship, if awarded.

*** FILING DEADLINE:  July 28, 2006 ***

Please read carefully.  Incomplete applications will not be processed.  Your application cannot be considered unless all forms are completed and returned to the KCSSF by the filing deadline above.  Application must be submitted directly to the KCSSF.

Korean Canadian Science Scholarship Foundation
1133 Leslie St., Suite 206
North York, Ontario M3C 2J6
Tel: (416) 449-5204, Fax: (416) 449-2875
E-mail: info@akcse.org

Scholarship recipients will be selected and notified by August 14, 2006, by the scolarship committee.
2006 AWARD INFORMATION PACKAGE

Please read the following information carefully and follow all instructions.  Any deviation will result in default and elimination of eligibility.

1.  APPLICATION PACKAGE
Official application form must be used.
Resume.
Personal statement
l        Prepare a personal statement of at least 250 words based on the following topic:  “What are the most important qualities needed to be a successful Scientist or Engineer?  How would a college education help you to become successful in this field?”
Must provide official transcripts for the academic years 2004/2005 and 2005-2006 from all former and current post-secondary institutions (whether or not a degree was granted).
l        Each envelope must be sealed and signed by the issuing institution.
l        DO NOT open the envelopes.
l        Transcripts received in an unsealed envelope are not official.
l        Enclose the transcripts with the scholarship application.
Two reference letters (eg. one from school and one from work or volunteer/leadership organization) are required from people that have direct knowledge of your character, ability, attitude, potential and aspiration.  References should exclude and signed envelopes.
l        Enclose the letters with the scholarship application.
Upon being selected to receive an award, recipients are required to submit two photographs (passport size but not necessarily passport photos) taken within the past six months.  Photographs are used for record and promotional purposes.

2.  AWARD CATEGORIES AND AWARD AMOUNTS

l        Undergraduate studies
l        Post-graduate studies including Medicine, Pharmacy & Dentistry

Number of Awards: 6
Amount of each award:
$3,000 @ 1 (SK Scholarship in Life Science)
$1,000 @ 1 (Korean Canadian Medical Association [KCMA])
$1,000 @ 4 (Korean Canadian Science Scholarship Foundation)

3.  SELECTION PROCESS

Application and all supporting documentation must be postmarked on or earlier of July 28, 2006.
Evaluation criteria are:
l        Academic performance
l        Community Services & Extra-curricular/Leadership activities
l        References
l        Personal statement
   Successful applicants must receive balanced scores from all four areas.

4.  Application Deadline- July 28, 2006
5.  SUBMISSTION ADDRESS
      Mail completed application to:
Korean Canadian Science Scholarship Foundation
1133 Leslie St., Suite 206
North York, Ontario M3C 2J6

6.  INQUIRY
The 2006 Award Information Package can be obtained from one of the following ways:
By e-mail: info@akcse.org
By Fax: (416) 449-2875
Download from http://www.akcse.org
Jeong-Ae An (416) 449-5204 (Administrator), Monday, Wednesday, and Thursday
President of each regional AKCSE chapters across Canada (there are 9 chapters)
